sentences.en: “Nobody tunes in to what anybody else is saying”(&b{Bruce Allen})
sentences.cn: “没有人注意别的人在说什么”(&b{布鲁斯·艾伦})

sentences.en: “The average reader, used to seeing the world in three-dimensional color, tunes out”(&b{Carlin Romano})
sentences.cn: “那些习惯于以三维色彩观察世界的普通读者与环境隔绝”(&b{卡林·罗马诺})

sentences.en: "We do tune our guitars before we go on," he insisted.
sentences.cn: “我们在演奏以前确实会为吉他调音，”他坚持说道。

sentences.en: And the fiddler played another little tune.
sentences.cn: 小提琴手又演奏了一首短曲。

sentences.en: As he washed he whistled a tune.
sentences.cn: 他边洗边用口哨吹着小曲。

sentences.en: Doesn't that sound like the signature tune from The Late Late Show?
sentences.cn: 那听起来像不像《深夜脱口秀》的开播曲？

sentences.en: It was just an ordinary voice, but he sang in tune.
sentences.cn: 他声音很一般，但唱得都在调子上。

sentences.en: it's important to &B{be tuned in} to your child's needs.
sentences.cn: 理解你孩子的需要是重要的。

sentences.en: it's important to &B{be tuned in} to your child's needs.
sentences.cn: 理解你孩子的需要是重要的。

sentences.en: it's important to &B{be tuned in} to your child's needs.
sentences.cn: 理解你孩子的需要是重要的。

sentences.en: It's no wonder the piano kept going out of tune.
sentences.cn: 难怪钢琴一直不在调上。

sentences.en: Many of the notes are out of tune.
sentences.cn: 很多音都走调了。

sentences.en: More than six million youngsters tune in to Blockbusters every day.
sentences.cn: 每天有600多万年轻人收看“热门大片”这档节目。

sentences.en: produced profits to the tune of about $20 million.
sentences.cn: 创利润达2亿美元之多

sentences.en: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.cn: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.en: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.cn: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

sentences.en: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.cn: 那曲调很美。

sentences.en: The peace campaigners were probably out of tune with most Britons.
sentences.cn: 和平倡导者可能不被大部分英国人认同。

sentences.en: The shop charges up to $500 to tune up a Porsche.
sentences.cn: 那家店调试一辆保时捷收费高达500美元。

sentences.en: Today, his change of direction seems more in tune with the times.
sentences.cn: 今天，他方向的改变似乎更与时代合拍。

sentences.en: Tommy Tune gives the choreography his usual class and zip.
sentences.cn: 汤米·图恩在编排的舞蹈中注入其一贯的优雅和活力。

sentences.en: tuned out the children's screaming.
sentences.cn: 对于孩子们的尖叫不予理睬

sentences.en: Who would then be calling the tune in Parliament?
sentences.cn: 那在国会谁说了算？

sentences.en: Yesterday he changed his tune, saying the fare increase was experimental.
sentences.cn: 昨天他变卦了，说提价只是试行。

sentences.en: You've changed your tune since this morning, haven't you?
sentences.cn: 你从今天早上就变卦了，是不是？

words.tran_cn: 经调谐的；谱好曲的；调好台的
和谐的；音调优美的；悦耳的
[电子][通信] 调谐；调音，起弦；协调一致；起音，定音
调整；调音；发出乐音（tune的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)意识到；对…敏感；能理解
vi. 改弦易辙，改变看法；改变论调
走调；不协调；（对某事）没有兴趣
校准(小提琴等乐器的)音调

phrases.phrase: there's many a good tune played on an old fiddle
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)旧琴拉佳曲（指一个人的能力并不取决于他的年轻）
&I{【俚语】} 注意，觉察到：使或变得明白或了解
调整，调节（以达最佳性能）
热身，准备活动：为某一特殊活动做准备

trans.tran_en: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to

trans.tran_cn: 为（乐器）调音，调试，调频道
trans.tran_en: to make a musical instrument play at the right  pitch

trans.tran_cn: 调整， 调节； 为调音
trans.tran_en: to make a musical instrument play at the right  pitch
